label: BLM BPL
description: Boston Public Library Suggestions Reading List

list.label: Between the world and me
Have Black lives ever mattered?
Heavy : an American memoir
How to be an antiracist
How to be less stupid about race : on racism, White supremacy, and the racial divide
I'm still here : black dignity in a world made for whiteness
Knife of dreams
Me and white supremacy : combat racism, change the world, and become a good ancestor
Men We Reaped
Modern ethics in 77 arguments : a Stone reader
On the other side of freedom : the case for hope
Pushout : the criminalization of Black girls in schools
Rest in power : the enduring life of Trayvon Martin
So you want to talk about race
Stamped : racism, antiracism, and you
Stamped from the beginning : the definitive history of racist ideas in America
Stay woke : a people's guide to making all Black lives matter
Tears we cannot stop : a sermon to white America
The color of compromise : the truth about the American church's complicity in racism
The color of law : a forgotten history of how our government segregated America
The fire this time : a new generation speaks about race
The New Jim Crow
The Poetry anthology, 1912-2002 : ninety years of America's most distinguished verse magazine
They can't kill us all : Ferguson, Baltimore, and a new era in America's racial justice movement

What Doesn't Kill You Makes You Blacker
When they call you a terrorist : a Black Lives Matter memoir
White fragility : why it's so hard for white people to talk about racism
White rage : the unspoken truth of our racial divide
Why I'm no longer talking to white people about race
